text: The 2016–17 Danish 2nd Divisions was divided in three groups of eight teams in the autumn. In spring there was a promotion play-off and a relegation play- off. The top two teams of the promotion play-off group were promoted to the 2017–18 Danish 1st Division. IK Skovbakken merged with Vejlby IK as of 1 July 2016 to form VSK Aarhus. ==Participants== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center;" |- !Club !Group !Finishing position last season !First season of current spell in 2nd Divisions |- |style="text-align:left;"|Aarhus Fremad||Group 3||||2015–16 |- |style="text-align:left;"|Avarta||Group 1||||2008–09 |- |style="text- align:left;"|B.93||Group 1||||2013–14 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Brabrand||Group 3||||2010–11 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Brønshøj Boldklub||Group 1||||2015–16 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Dalum IF||Group 2||||2015–16 |- |style="text-align:left;"|FC Svendborg||Group 2||||2008–09 |- |style="text-align:left;"|FC Sydvest 05||Group 2||||2016–17 |- |style="text-align:left;"|Fredensborg BI||Group 1||||2016–17 |- |style="text-align:left;"|Frem||Group 1||||2012–13 |- |style="text-align:left;"|Greve||Group 2||||2016–17 |- |style="text- align:left;"|HIK||Group 1||||2008–09 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Holbæk||Group 1||||2009–10 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Hvidovre||Group 1||||2014–15 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Jammerbugt FC||Group 3||||2012–13 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Kjellerup||Group 3||||2016–17 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Kolding IF||Group 2||||2014–15 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Marienlyst||Group 2||||2014–15 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Middelfart||Group 2||||2012–13 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Næsby||Group 2||||2004–05 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Odder||Group 3||||2013–14 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Thisted||Group 3||||2010–11 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Vejgaard||Group 3||||2016–17 |- |style="text-align:left;"|VSK Aarhus||Group 3||||2010–11 |} ==Group 1== ===League table=== ==Group 2== ===League table=== ==Group 3== ===League table=== ==Promotion Group== === League table === The top 4 teams from each group competed for 2 spots in the 2017–18 Danish 1st Division. The points and goals that the teams won in the autumn group against other participants in the promotion group were transferred to the promotion group. ==Relegation Group== === League table === The bottom 4 teams from each group competed to avoid the 4 relegations spots to the Denmark Series. The points and goals that the teams won in the autumn group against other participants in the relegation group were transferred to the relegation group. ==References== 3 Danish 2nd Divisions Category:Danish 2nd Division seasons Category:2016–17 in Danish football leagues
title: 2016–17 Danish 2nd Divisions
